showScoreExcerpt:
Laura Linney and Jessica Hecht sit at the same table but don’t look at one another, nor talk to each other, at the beginning of this exquisitely acted production of David Auburn’s gauzy, bittersweet, and largely inert new play….“Summer, 1976” has the modest lyricism of a short story, albeit one voiced by world-class actresses. It’s no surprise that Audible is planning to release a recording of it as an audiobook.
